intro: Rhus huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén persimmon, is a species of flowering plant in the Anacardiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that develop into edible, fleshy fruits. Rhus huillensis is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments with cool, humid conditions. Its fruit is valued for its sweet, aromatic flavor and is often consumed fresh or used in traditional culinary practices.
